org.xlattice.util

Class JnlpVersionMatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.util.JnlpVersionMatcher

  • public class JnlpVersionMatcher
extends java.lang.Object
    Specifier for a set of JNLP-compatible version numbers and the type of matches permitted. JNLP (Webstart, JSR056) version numbers consist of a number of parts delimited by any of a set of separators (dot, dash, or underscore: ".-_"). The parts themselves may consist of any character not in the set of delimiters.

    Each possible match is specified as a JNLP version number with an optional modifier, star (*) or plus (+), indicating the type of match permitted. If there is no modifier, the match must be exact. Separator characters are not considered in comparisons, so 1-2_3 is an exact match for 1.2.3.

    If the + modifier is present, any version number which is an exact match for or sorts after the version number in the pattern will succeed. In making this comparison between version numbers with differing numbers of parts, the shorter version number is in effect padded out with zeroes. Numeric comparison is used if possible, but if either of the pair of parts being compared contains non-digit characters, the two parts are compared lexigraphically. Given these considerations, 4.1 is an exact match for 4.1.0.0,sorts before 4.A, and sorts after 4./, because the character '/' precedes the character '1' in sort order whereas 'A' follows it.

    If the * modifier is present, version numbers match if they are identical or if they have different numbers of parts but the initial parts of the longer version number are identical to all of the corresponding parts of the shorter version number.

    Within the version matcher initialization string, version numbers are separated by spaces. There must be no delimiter between the version number and modifier (*+), if a modifier is present.

    As an example: 

       1.2.3 4_5_6* 7-8-9+
    would match 1-2-3 (exactly), 4.5.6.7 (as a partial match), or 10_7 (because it sorts after 7.8.9.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Constructor Detail

      • JnlpVersionMatcher

        public JnlpVersionMatcher(java.lang.String s)
        Create a matcher for JNLP (Webstart, JSR 56) versions. This is a space-separated list of JNLP version numbers, each with optional specifiers (+ or *). Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored and any series of one or more spaces or tabs is treated as a single delimitor; both are extensions to the JNLP specs.
        Parameters:
        s - String containing one or more JNLP version descriptors.

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public JnlpVersion getVersion(int n)
        Return the version part of the Nth version element. This is the JNLP version number, without any optional modifier (+ or *).
        Parameters:
        n - zero-based index
        Returns:
        the JNLP version of the Nth element

      • getType

        public int getType(int n)
        Returns the type of matching (the modifier) for the Nth version matcher. This is one of EXACT, OR_BETTER, QMARK, for exact, exact or better, and partial matches respectively.
        Returns:
        matching type for the Nth version

      • match

        public boolean match(JnlpVersion v)
        Whether there is a match between the candidate version number and ANY of the elements of this matcher. Each of the matcher elements is checked in turn. If any matches, true is returned immediately.
        Parameters:
        v - JNLP version number being tested for a match

      • match

        public boolean match(java.lang.String s)
        Whether there is a match between a JNLP version number specified as a String and ANY of the elements of this matcher.
        Parameters:
        s - JNLP version number in Strng form

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        the number of JnlpVersions in the matcher
